Questions.QuestionString: Which type is the ignition system?
Answers: Low voltage, high energy
High voltage, low energy
High voltage, high energy

Questions.QuestionString: What happens in case a surge is detected in flight or during take-off?
Answers: Igniters will be powered until 30 seconds after the surge recovers
Only one igniter will be powered, the other will be hot standby
Igniters will be powered and cut-off immediately after the surge recovers

Questions.QuestionString: What provides the selection of ignition A/B?
Answers: The EEC
The engine control panel
The ECAM control panel

Questions.QuestionString: When using the Manual start ignition selection:
Answers: EEC energizes one of igniters based on logic and aircraft inputs of flap position
EEC energizes both igniters based on logic and aircraft inputs of flap position, cowl anti-ice status, and/or continuous ignition commands
EEC energizes both igniters based on logic and aircraft inputs of thrust lever position, cowl anti-ice status, and/or continuous ignition commands
An active ignition system will work continuously
Both ignition systems are selected during engine start
Both ignition systems are demanded to work continuously
One ignition system with two igniters
Two ignition systems, each has two igniters
Two ignition systems with two igniters
115 V from the aircraft
115 V from engine generator
28 V from the FADEC PMA

Questions.QuestionString: How many ignition exciter units are located on PW 1100G engine?
In what conditions is the automatic dual-igniter continuous ignition provided by EEC?
Answers: An engine flameout or a surge during takeoff or when fuel cutback due to Thrust Control Malfunction (TCM)
FADEC failure
Exciter Unit failure

Questions.QuestionString: During an autostart on the ground, exciters are alternated as follows:
Answers: EEC Channel A - Igniter 1, EEC Channel B - Igniter 1, EEC Channel A - Igniter 2, EEC Channel B - Igniter 2.
EEC Channel A - Igniter 1, EEC Channel B - Igniter 2, EEC Channel A - Igniter 2, EEC Channel B - Igniter 1.
EEC active channel randomly select the igniters.

Questions.QuestionString: The ignition system has the following number of Ignition Exciter Boxes and Igniter Plugs:
Answers: One Ignition Exciter Box and two Igniter plugs
Two Ignition Exciter Boxes and two Igniter plugs
One Ignition Exciter Box and one Igniter plug

Questions.QuestionString: During an auto start on the ground, exciters are alternated as follows:
